## Overview

In most cases, you describe your app’s data model using Xcode’s data model editor. [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSManagedObjectModel] represents the `.xcdatamodeld` file in your project’s source list. This is where you define entities that you use to generate [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSManagedObject] subclasses for Core Data to manage.

The entities you create are [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSEntityDescription] instances. Entities’ properties are subclasses of [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSPropertyDescription], namely [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeDescription] for attributes, [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSRelationshipDescription] for relationships, and [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSFetchedPropertyDescription] for fetched properties.

The various attribute types are enumerated in [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeType].

# Core Data model

**API Collection**

Describe your app’s object structure.

## Overview

In most cases, you describe your app’s data model using Xcode’s data model editor. [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSManagedObjectModel] represents the `.xcdatamodeld` file in your project’s source list. This is where you define entities that you use to generate [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSManagedObject] subclasses for Core Data to manage.

The entities you create are [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSEntityDescription] instances. Entities’ properties are subclasses of [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSPropertyDescription], namely [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeDescription] for attributes, [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSRelationshipDescription] for relationships, and [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSFetchedPropertyDescription] for fetched properties.

The various attribute types are enumerated in [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeType].

## Objects and entities

- **NSManagedObject**: The base class that all Core Data model objects inherit from.
- **NSEntityDescription**: A description of a Core Data entity.

## Standard attributes

- **NSPropertyDescription**: A description of a single property belonging to an entity.
- **NSAttributeDescription**: A description of a single attribute belonging to an entity.
- **NSAttributeType**: The types of attribute that Core Data supports.
- **NSRelationshipDescription**: A description of a relationship between two entities.

## Computed attributes

- **NSCompositeAttributeDescription**: A description of an attribute that derives its value by composing other attributes.
- **NSDerivedAttributeDescription**: A description of an attribute that derives its value by performing a calculation on a related attribute.

## Fetched properties

- **NSFetchedPropertyDescription**: A description object used to define which properties are fetched from Core Data.

## Data modeling

- **Modeling data**: Configure the data model file to contain your app’s object graph.
